Detailed Description

A class that calculates the repulsive forces between CPSs.

Member Function Documentation

◆ attract()

void repulsion::attract ( geometry_msgs::Vector3 &  attraction,
double  closest 
)
private

Calculate the direction towards the original goal during collision avoidance.

Parameters
attractionReturns the attraction vector, i.e., the direction of the goal with the magnitude calculated from the closest CPS distance.
closestThe distance to the closest CPS.

Definition at line 142 of file repulsion.cpp.

◆ calc()

bool repulsion::calc ( )

Check whether collision avoidance is necessary and calculate respective position or velocity.

Returns
Whether collision avoidance is necessary. Also false if class not properly initialized.

Definition at line 24 of file repulsion.cpp.

◆ get_dir()

geometry_msgs::Vector3 repulsion::get_dir ( )

Get the direction in which to move for collision avoidance.

Returns
A pose with the current position of the CPS and the direction away from the other CPSs.

Definition at line 127 of file repulsion.cpp.

◆ get_pos()

geometry_msgs::PoseStamped repulsion::get_pos ( )

Get the intermediate goal position during collision avoidance.

Returns
The pose where the CPS shall move to for avoiding a collision.

Definition at line 132 of file repulsion.cpp.

◆ get_vel()

geometry_msgs::Twist repulsion::get_vel ( )

Get the intermediate target velocity during collision avoidance.

Returns
The velocity at which the CPS shall move for avoiding a collision.

Definition at line 137 of file repulsion.cpp.

◆ init()

void repulsion::init ( double  dist_critical,
double  dist_attract,
double  dist_repulse,
string  attraction_shape,
string  repulsion_shape 
)

Configure the repulsion behavior through parameters.

Parameters
dist_criticalDistance between CPSs in meter below which the collision avoidance will work maximally, i.e., maximum repulsion, no attraction.
dist_attractDistance between CPSs in meter below which attraction starts to decrease. Must be greater than dist_critical.
dist_repulseDistance between CPSs in meter below which repulsion starts to increase. Must be greater than dist_critical.
attraction_shapeThe shape of the attraction function.
repulsion_shapeThe shape of the repulsion function.

Definition at line 9 of file repulsion.cpp.

◆ repulse()

void repulsion::repulse ( geometry_msgs::Vector3 &  repulsion,
int &  neighbors,
double &  closest 
)
private

Calculate repulsion from close by CPSs.

Parameters
repulsionReturns the repulsion vector, i.e., the sum of the vectors pointing away from the neighbors.
neighborsReturns the number of neighbors that create repulsion.
closestReturns the distance to the closest neighbor.
